alert.note: Alert for Cave Creek, New River; Mazatzal Mountains; New River Mesa; Rio Verde, Salt River; Tonto Basin (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 29 at 9:48AM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Gila and Maricopa Counties through 1030 AM MST... At 948 AM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles north of Rio Verde, or 10 miles west of Round Valley, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sunflower, Sycamore Creek and Rio Verde. This includes AZ Route 87 between mile markers 213 and 226. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Cave Creek, New River; Mazatzal Mountains; New River Mesa; Rio Verde, Salt River; Tonto Basin
